tasks.task: Discussing methods of weed control in agriculture.
subtasks: Exposition of principles of weed control (prevention, eradication, control, management).
Explanation of mechanical (physical) methods of weed control.
Description of tillage as the oldest method, including its operations and benefits.
Explanation of hoeing as a method for perennial weeds and its historical use.
Description of hand weeding using tools like khurpi or sickle.
Explanation of digging for controlling perennial weeds with underground propagating parts.
Description of sickling and moving for removing top growth and erosion control.
Explanation of burning as a weed control method, particularly after sugar cane harvesting.
Description of flooding as a method for water-sensitive weeds.
Summary of merits and demerits of mechanical (physical) weed control methods.
